decks.notes: The deck focuses on generating value and controlling the game through a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and powerful creatures. It aims to grind out opponents with card advantage and disruption while setting up for big plays with Emergent Ultimatum. Yorion serves as both a companion and a way to reset board states with its blink ability. The deck also utilizes a variety of modal spells and lands to ensure flexibility in its mana base and game plan.

This deck focuses on controlling the board through a combination of removal spells and counterspells. By utilizing cards like Negate, Eliminate, and Heartless Act, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up its own win condition. The deck also includes powerful cards like Emergent Ultimatum and Yorion, Sky Nomad to generate value and outvalue the opponent. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the three-color combination of green, blue, and black, allowing for flexibility in casting spells and utilizing the deck's various powerful threats and answers.

The deck focuses on utilizing cycling cards to draw into powerful cards such as Zenith Flare and Irencrag Pyromancer to deal damage quickly. It also includes cards like Improbable Alliance and Valiant Rescuer to create tokens for additional pressure. Teferi, Master of Time provides card advantage and control options. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of efficient creatures, burn spells, and cycling synergies to finish the game before the opponent can establish their own game plan.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and powerful combat tricks. By utilizing efficient creatures like Bonecrusher Giant and Questing Beast, along with removal spells like Scorching Dragonfire and Shatterskull Smashing, the deck aims to maintain board control and deal damage quickly. The inclusion of Embercleave allows for explosive turns and the potential for finishing off opponents in just a few swings. The Gruul Aggro archetype emphasizes speed and aggression, aiming to win the game before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

This Gruul Aggro deck focuses on quickly playing powerful creatures like Questing Beast, Goldspan Dragon, and Brushfire Elemental to deal damage to the opponent as fast as possible. It also includes key removal spells like Bonecrusher Giant and Fire Prophecy to control the board. The deck aims to maintain aggression and pressure on the opponent while utilizing cards like The Great Henge and Embercleave to boost its creatures' power and close out the game swiftly. This deck emphasizes speed and efficiency in dealing damage to overwhelm the opponent.

The deck focuses on aggressive play and utilizing cycling abilities to quickly cycle through your deck, create tokens, deal damage, and draw cards. Improbable Alliance, Drannith Stinger, and Valiant Rescuer create tokens, while Zenith Flare and Irencrag Pyromancer can deal significant damage. The deck also includes cycling cards like Boon of the Wish-Giver and Frostveil Ambush to draw cards and trigger abilities. By efficiently cycling through your deck, you can overwhelm your opponent with a flurry of creatures, spells, and damage.

This deck focuses on quickly playing efficient, aggressive creatures to overwhelm the opponent. It includes powerful cards such as Questing Beast and Vorinclex, Monstrous Raider, along with mana acceleration from cards like Tangled Florahedron and Kazandu Mammoth. The deck also includes some creature removal options with Gemrazer and Primal Might. The goal is to establish a strong board presence early in the game and use cards like The Great Henge to maintain card advantage and keep up the pressure on the opponent.

The main concept of this Sultai Control deck is to establish board control and card advantage through a variety of removal spells, counterspells, and card draw options. By utilizing Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion, the deck aims to generate incremental value through its enter-the-battlefield triggers. The deck also includes powerful finishers like Alrund's Epiphany and Shark Typhoon to close out the game once the opponent's resources have been depleted. With an emphasis on control and resource management, this deck aims to outvalue and outlast its opponents in Standard 1 vs 1 matches.

The deck focuses on utilizing the companion Yorion, Sky Nomad to create value through blinking permanents for additional effects. The main deck consists of various control cards such as counterspells, removal spells, and enchantments to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes a mix of land cards to ensure consistent mana base. By controlling the board state and generating card advantage with Yorion, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and ultimately win the game through attrition.

This deck focuses on quickly cycling through cards to build up a board presence and deal damage to the opponent. By utilizing cards like Improbable Alliance and Zenith Flare, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a constant stream of threats. Drannith Stinger and Irencrag Pyromancer provide additional reach and damage potential, while Valiant Rescuer and Flourishing Fox offer early game aggression. The deck also includes cards like Go for Blood and Boon of the Wish-Giver for removal and card advantage. Overall, the deck aims to win the game through aggressive cycling and efficient card usage.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize cycling cards to quickly fill up the graveyard and power up Zenith Flare for a potent finisher. By cycling through the deck, players can also trigger effects from cards like Improbable Alliance and Irencrag Pyromancer, while maintaining pressure on the opponent with efficient and aggressive creatures like Flourishing Fox and Drannith Stinger. Teferi, Master of Time provides additional card advantage and control options, making this deck a fast-paced and versatile aggro strategy with strong late-game potential.

This deck focuses on quickly cycling through cards to trigger effects that deal damage or create tokens, building up a board presence and overwhelming the opponent with aggressive plays. By cycling through cards efficiently, the deck can consistently deal damage with Zenith Flare and Irencrag Pyromancer while generating tokens with Improbable Alliance and Valiant Rescuer. The inclusion of Teferi, Master of Time provides card advantage and ensures the deck remains proactive. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to maintain a fast and relentless aggro strategy through efficient card cycling and token generation.

The deck focuses on fast and aggressive creature plays, aiming to overwhelm the opponent quickly. It includes a mix of early game creatures and spells to establish board presence, followed by powerful mid-game threats like Felidar Retreat and Showdown of the Skalds to further pressure the opponent. The inclusion of Jegantha as a companion adds flexibility and additional synergy to the deck. Overall, the key concept is to outpace the opponent with a combination of efficient creatures, impactful spells, and a strong mana base for consistent performance.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying aggressive creatures and overwhelming the opponent with a steady stream of threats. By utilizing the companion Jegantha, the Wellspring to access additional mana and a diverse mana base, the deck can consistently play its powerful cards on curve. Cards like Toski, Bearer of Secrets and Lovestruck Beast provide card advantage and pressure, while Gemrazer and Giant Killer offer removal options. Showdown of the Skalds acts as a powerful finisher, allowing the deck to close out games quickly. The deck aims to outpace the opponent and maintain board presence throughout the game.

The main idea of the deck is to play aggressively with low-cost creatures and burn spells to deal damage quickly to the opponent. The deck focuses on maximizing damage output with cards like Torbran, Thane of Red Fell and Embercleave, while also utilizing snow lands to enable Frost Bite as efficient removal. The inclusion of Faceless Haven provides a resilient threat that can close out games quickly. Additionally, the deck has some card advantage with Robber of the Rich and efficient removal with Bonecrusher Giant.

This Sultai Control deck focuses on controlling the game through removal spells like Heartless Act and Jwari Disruption, while also utilizing powerful cards like Emergent Ultimatum and Alrund's Epiphany to take over the game in the late stages. The deck also has strong ramp options with Cultivate and Wolfwillow Haven to help cast its high-costed spells like Shark Typhoon and Vorinclex, Monstrous Raider. Yorion, Sky Nomad serves as a companion to add consistency and value to the deck, making it a versatile and potent control archetype in the Standard 1 vs 1 format.
